.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataTruncation extends Java.Sql.SQLWarning implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.IO.ISerializable, class System.IDisposable
type DataTruncation = class inherit SQLWarning interface ISerializable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: An exception thrown as a DataTruncation exception (on writes) or reported as a DataTruncation warning (on reads) when a data values is unexpectedly truncated for reasons other than its having execeeded MaxFieldSize.

remarks.para: An exception thrown as a DataTruncation exception (on writes) or reported as a DataTruncation warning (on reads) when a data values is unexpectedly truncated for reasons other than its having execeeded MaxFieldSize.
The SQLstate for a DataTruncation during read is 01004.
The SQLstate for a DataTruncation during write is 22001.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The index of the parameter or column value
true if a parameter value was truncated
true if a read was truncated
the original size of the data
Docs.summary: Creates a DataTruncation object with the SQLState initialized to 01004 when read is set to true and 22001 when read is set to false, the reason set to "Data truncation", the vendor code set to 0, and the other fields set to the given values.

remarks.para: Creates a DataTruncation object with the SQLState initialized to 01004 when read is set to true and 22001 when read is set to false, the reason set to "Data truncation", the vendor code set to 0, and the other fields set to the given values. The cause is not initialized, and may subsequently be initialized by a call to the Throwable#initCause(java.lang.Throwable) method.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of bytes of data that should have been transferred.
Docs.value: the number of bytes of data that should have been transferred

remarks.para: Gets the number of bytes of data that should have been transferred. This number may be approximate if data conversions were being performed. The value may be -1 if the size is unknown.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the index of the column or parameter that was truncated.
Docs.value: the index of the truncated paramter or column value

remarks.para: Retrieves the index of the column or parameter that was truncated.
This may be -1 if the column or parameter index is unknown, in which case the parameter and read fields should be ignored.
